chapter.para: Implement, document, and publish an industrial-strength compiler for the Co-Dfns language. This includes the publication of new research into compiler technologies and formal software design. The intention of this effort is to have a complete and solid foundation upon which to build both a successful commercial enterprise and a solid and productive research agenda.

The Co-Dfns language is a simple extension of the D-fns language. It implements two concepts on top of the existing language: parallel, concurrent execution using the monadic operator ∥, which executes its argument concurrently and in parallel with the code following it; and, the constant ⌾, which is an empty, single-assignment array. The fill element of a single assignment array is a cell that blocks on all attempts to read from it until there is a write to it. Only a single write is permitted to a given cell.

The completion of this project at the beginning of October is the first version, implementing only the semantics and making only such optimizations as are expedient. A future version is intended to address the issues of performance to a greater degree.
